snippet: While Airbnb has begun offering secondary insurance coverage to its hosts in the United States, guests in other countries may have to cover the costs of any accidents themselves.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column highlights experience of Mike Silverman, Airbnb user who was bitten by host's dog while staying in Argentina, to point out the inadequacy of service's liability coverage; notes that company resists inquiries into how often such accidents happen, but expresses hope that company will not compel victims of accidents to fight to be reimbursed and compensated.
lead_paragraph: While Airbnb has begun offering secondary insurance coverage to its hosts in the United States, guests in other countries may have to cover the costs of any accidents themselves.

headline.print_headline: Dog Bites Airbnb Guest. Who Pays?
headline.main: Questions About Airbnb’s Responsibility After Attack by Dog
